project.name: Pixi Flash
project.description: A SpringRoll plugin for handling assets exported through Flash's CreateJS publishing.

pixiflash.FlashArt.name: pixiflash.FlashArt
pixiflash.FlashArt.description: Handles the Asset loading for Flash Art takes care of unloading

params.name: dom
params.description: The `<script>` element added to the document

pixiflash.FlashArtTask.name: pixiflash.FlashArtTask
pixiflash.FlashArtTask.description:
Replaces Bitmaps in the global lib dictionary with a faux Bitmap
that pulls the image from a spritesheet.

props.name: images
props.description: An array of Image, TextureAtlas, or SpriteSheet assets to load

props.name: cache
props.description: If we should cache the result

props.name: complete
props.description: The event to call when done

props.name: sizes
props.description: Define if certain sizes are not supported

pixiflash.SpriteSheetTask.name: pixiflash.SpriteSheetTask
pixiflash.SpriteSheetTask.description: Load a spritesheet generated from Flash and adds it to the global ss namespace.

props.name: cache
props.description: If we should cache the result

props.name: complete
props.description: The event to call when done

props.name: sizes
props.description: Define if certain sizes are not supported

pixiflash.DisplayObject.name: pixiflash.DisplayObject
pixiflash.DisplayObject.description: Mixins for the display objects used for bridging CreateJS over to PIXI.

pixiflash.MovieClip.name: pixiflash.MovieClip
pixiflash.MovieClip.description: The class to emulate createjs.MovieClip, requires TweenJS

pixiflash.MovieClipPlugin.name: pixiflash.MovieClipPlugin
pixiflash.MovieClipPlugin.description: This plugin works with TweenJS to prevent the startPosition property from tweening.

classitems.description:
If false, the tick will not be propagated to children of this Container. This can provide some performance benefits.
In addition to preventing the "tick" event from being dispatched, it will also prevent tick related updates
on some display objects (ex. Sprite & MovieClip frame advancing, DOMElement visibility handling).
classitems.name: tickChildren

params.name: delta
params.description: Time elapsed since the previous tick, in milliseconds.

classitems.description: x and y skew of the display object, with values in radians.
classitems.name: skew

classitems.description: Rotation of the display object, with values in radians.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description:
If false, the tick will not run on this display object (or its children). This can provide some performance benefits.
In addition to preventing the "tick" event from being dispatched, it will also prevent tick related updates
on some display objects (ex. Sprite & MovieClip frame advancing, DOMElement visibility handling).
classitems.name: tickEnabled

classitems.description:
The x skew value of the display object, in degrees.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: skewX

classitems.description:
The y skew value of the display object, in degrees.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: skewY

classitems.description:
The rotation of the display object, in degrees.
This overrides the radian degrees of the PIXI display objects so that
tweening exported from Flash will work correctly.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description:
The x scale value of the display object.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: scaleX

classitems.description:
The y scale value of the display object.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: scaleY

classitems.description:
The x value of the registration, or pivot, point.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: regX

classitems.description:
The y value of the registration, or pivot, point.
This property provides parity with CreateJS display objects.
classitems.name: regY

classitems.description:
Controls how this MovieClip advances its time. Must be one of 0 (INDEPENDENT), 1 (SINGLE_FRAME), or 2 (SYNCHED).
See each constant for a description of the behaviour.
classitems.name: mode

classitems.description: Specifies what the first frame to play in this movieclip, or the only frame to display if mode is SINGLE_FRAME.
classitems.name: startPosition

classitems.description: Indicates whether this MovieClip should loop when it reaches the end of its timeline.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description: The current frame of the movieclip.
classitems.name: currentFrame
timeline

classitems.description: If true, the MovieClip's position will not advance when ticked.
classitems.name: paused

classitems.description: If true, actions in this MovieClip's tweens will be run when the playhead advances.
classitems.name: actionsEnabled

classitems.description:
If true, the MovieClip will automatically be reset to its first frame whenever the timeline adds it back onto the display list. This only applies to MovieClip instances with mode=INDEPENDENT.

For example, if you had a character animation with a "body" child MovieClip instance with different costumes on each frame, you could set body.autoReset = false, so that you can manually change the frame it is on, without worrying that it will be reset automatically.
classitems.name: autoReset

classitems.description:
Note - changed from default: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time
elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.
classitems.name: _t

classitems.description:
By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.
classitems.name: _framerate

classitems.description: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the total time in seconds for the animation.
classitems.name: _duration

classitems.description: List of display objects that are actively being managed by the MovieClip.
classitems.name: _managed

classitems.description:
The MovieClip will advance independently of its parent, even if its parent is paused.
This is the default mode.
classitems.name: INDEPENDENT

classitems.description: The MovieClip will only display a single frame (as determined by the startPosition property).
classitems.name: SINGLE_FRAME

classitems.description:
The MovieClip will be advanced only when its parent advances and will be synched to the position of
the parent MovieClip.
classitems.name: SYNCHED

classitems.description: Use the {{#crossLink "MovieClip/labels:property"}}{{/crossLink}} property instead.
classitems.name: getLabels

classitems.description: Use the {{#crossLink "MovieClip/currentLabel:property"}}{{/crossLink}} property instead.
classitems.name: getCurrentLabel

classitems.description:
Returns an array of objects with label and position (aka frame) properties, sorted by position.
Shortcut to TweenJS: Timeline.getLabels();
classitems.name: labels

classitems.description:
Returns the name of the label on or immediately before the current frame. See TweenJS: Timeline.getCurrentLabel()
for more information.
classitems.name: currentLabel

classitems.description: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.
classitems.name: elapsedTime

classitems.description:
By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.

For example, if a MovieClip with a framerate of 10 is placed on a Stage being updated at 40fps, then the MovieClip will
advance roughly one frame every 4 ticks. This will not be exact, because the time between each tick will
vary slightly between frames.

This feature is dependent on the tick event object (or an object with an appropriate "delta" property) being
passed into {{#crossLink "Stage/update"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: framerate

classitems.description: Sets paused to false.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Sets paused to true.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to false.
classitems.name: gotoAndPlay

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation name or frame number to go to.

classitems.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to true.
classitems.name: gotoAndStop

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation or frame name to go to.

classitems.description: Advances the playhead. This occurs automatically each tick by default.

params.name: time
params.description: The amount of time in ms to advance by. Only applicable if framerate is set.

classitems.name: advance

params.name: delta
params.description:
Time elapsed since the previous tick, in milliseconds.
function.

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation name or frame number to go to.

classitems.description: Adds a child to the timeline, and sets it up as a managed child.
classitems.name: _addManagedChild

classitems.description:
The drawing graphics, these are necessary
for the compability with EaselJS Flash exports.
classitems.name: graphics

classitems.description: Map of Base64 characters to values. Used by {{#crossLink "Graphics/decodePath"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: BASE_64

classitems.description: Draws a line from the current drawing point to the specified position, which become the new current drawing point. A tiny API method "lt" also exists. For detailed information, read the whatwg spec.
classitems.name: lt

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate the drawing point should draw to.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate the drawing point should draw to.

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description: Moves the drawing point to the specified position. A tiny API method "mt" also exists.
classitems.name: mt

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate the drawing point should move to.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate the drawing point should move to.

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls).

classitems.description: Draws a bezier curve from the current drawing point to (x, y) using the control points (cp1x, cp1y) and (cp2x, cp2y). For detailed information, read the whatwg spec. A tiny API method "bt" also exists.
classitems.name: bt

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description: Draws a quadratic curve from the current drawing point to (x, y) using the control point (cpx, cpy). For detailed information, read the whatwg spec. A tiny API method "qt" also exists.
classitems.name: qt

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description:
Closes the current path, effectively drawing a line from the current drawing point to the first drawing point specified
since the fill or stroke was last set. A tiny API method "cp" also exists.
classitems.name: cp

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description: Begins a fill with the specified color. This ends the current sub-path. A tiny API method "f" also exists.
classitems.name: f

params.name: color
params.description:
A CSS compatible color value (ex. "red", "#FF0000", or "rgba(255,0,0,0.5)"). Setting to
null will result in no fill.

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description:
Sets the stroke style. Like all drawing methods, this can be chained, so you can define
the stroke style and color in a single line of code like so:

	myGraphics.setStrokeStyle(8,"round").beginStroke("#F00");

A tiny API method "ss" also exists.
classitems.name: ss

params.name: caps
params.description:
Indicates the type of caps to use at the end of lines. One of butt,
round, or square. Defaults to "butt". Also accepts the values 0 (butt), 1 (round), and 2 (square) for use with
the tiny API.

params.name: joints
params.description:
Specifies the type of joints that should be used where two lines meet.
One of bevel, round, or miter. Defaults to "miter". Also accepts the values 0 (miter), 1 (round), and 2 (bevel)
for use with the tiny API.

params.name: miterLimit
params.description:
If joints is set to "miter", then you can specify a miter limit ratio which
controls at what point a mitered joint will be clipped.

params.name: ignoreScale
params.description:
If true, the stroke will be drawn at the specified thickness regardless
of active transformations.

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description: Begins a stroke with the specified color. This ends the current sub-path. A tiny API method "s" also exists.
classitems.name: s

params.name: color
params.description:
A CSS compatible color value (ex. "#FF0000", "red", or "rgba(255,0,0,0.5)"). Setting to
null will result in no stroke.

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)

classitems.description:
Decodes a compact encoded path string into a series of draw instructions. This format is not intended to be human readable, and is meant for use by authoring tools. The format uses a base64 character set, with each character representing 6 bits, to define a series of draw commands. Each command is comprised of a single "header" character followed by a variable number of alternating x and y position values. Reading the header bits from left to right (most to least significant): bits 1 to 3 specify the type of operation (0-moveTo, 1-lineTo, 2-quadraticCurveTo, 3-bezierCurveTo, 4-closePath, 5-7 unused). Bit 4 indicates whether position values use 12 bits (2 characters) or 18 bits (3 characters), with a one indicating the latter. Bits 5 and 6 are currently unused. Following the header is a series of 0 (closePath), 2 (moveTo, lineTo), 4 (quadraticCurveTo), or 6 (bezierCurveTo) parameters. These parameters are alternating x/y positions represented by 2 or 3 characters (as indicated by the 4th bit in the command char). These characters consist of a 1 bit sign (1 is negative, 0 is positive), followed by an 11 (2 char) or 17 (3 char) bit integer value. All position values are in tenths of a pixel. Except in the case of move operations which are absolute, this value is a delta from the previous x or y position (as appropriate). For example, the string "A3cAAMAu4AAA" represents a line starting at -150,0 and ending at 150,0.
A - bits 000000. First 3 bits (000) indicate a moveTo operation. 4th bit (0) indicates 2 chars per parameter.
n0 - 110111011100. Absolute x position of -150.0px. First bit indicates a negative value, remaining bits indicate 1500 tenths of a pixel.
AA - 000000000000. Absolute y position of 0.
I - 001100. First 3 bits (001) indicate a lineTo operation. 4th bit (1) indicates 3 chars per parameter.
Au4 - 000000101110111000. An x delta of 300.0px, which is added to the previous x value of -150.0px to provide an absolute position of +150.0px.
AAA - 000000000000000000. A y delta value of 0. A tiny API method "p" also exists.
classitems.name: p

return.description: The Graphics instance the method is called on (useful for chaining calls.)
